result.execSummary:
The defendant Shane Dave Lewis was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Vehicle Operator Flee/Elude Officer [Modifiers: Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.04(3).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

miscConds.notes: Pay stipulated restitution in the amount of $31.26 to the victim of 14CF4871, Quentin D., plus the DNA surcharge, all costs and surcharges. Should defendant get revoked and be sent to prison, COurt ordered monies to be taken from the Department of Corrections of up to 25% of prison funds. Balance to be paid while on extended supervision. Failure to pay amounts in full would result in a civil judgment.

Seek and maintain employment.
Be given job and vocational training.
The Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon not to possess any firearms.

No controlled substances or alcohol.
No contact with the victim, Quentin D.

Court ordered defendant to provide a DNA sample.
Cognitive thinking intervention counseling.
Court further advised defendant of voting ineligibility.

AODA assessment and treatment.
Urine screens.

timeConds.notes: With Huber if employed and release to the Day Reporting Center. No good time. Should defendant be removed from the Day Reporting Center, balance of time would be served without release.

Original Transcript (37 pages) GULITY PLEA/SENTENCING HEARING, commencing DECEMBER 22, 2014, received and filed.
Order signed and filed. The defendant's request for release on electronic monitoring is denied. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.
Per order of Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this request/motion is hereby assigned to the Hon. Stephanie G. Rothstein, Br. 25, for review. jbs
Defendant's pro se request for release on electronic monitoring.
/Denying Request for Good Time Credit, signed and filed.  Copy sent to defendant; copy sent to the District Attorney's Office.
Per Order of the Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this motion/request is hereby assigned to the Hon. Dennis P. Moroney, Br. 20, for review. mag
Defendant's pro se request for good time credit.

Attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent in court, defendant Shane Dave Lewis not in court, in custody.  Sara Nicole Volden Schroeder appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense counsel requested a plea date.  Plea hearing scheduled for December 22, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Original Transcript PRELIMINARY HEARING  (14 pages) commencing OCTOBER 30, 2014 received and filed.

Attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent in court, defendant Shane Dave Lewis not in court, in custody.  Sara Nicole Volden Schroeder appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Defense counsel did not proceed with bail hearing; requested another scheduling date.  Scheduling conference scheduled for December 1, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Shane Dave Lewis in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Defendant Shane Dave Lewis in custody.  Sara Nicole Volden Schroeder appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state:Raed Mseitif-Greenfield Police Department Officer.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and pleads not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 20.  Scheduling conference scheduled for November 6, 2014 at 08:30 am.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for November 6, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent in court, defendant Shane Dave Lewis not in court, in custody.  Ben Wesson for Jay R. Pucek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Due to time of day and the Court's calendar, the Preliminary Hearing was not able to be commenced in a timely manner.  Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for Preliminary Hearing in Branch PE.  Scheduling conference scheduled for October 30, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Electronic Monitoring. Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings. Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Shane Dave Lewis in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Defendant Shane Dave Lewis in custody.  Sarah McNutt appeared for the State of Wisconsin. TK 
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Moroney, Branch 20.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings. DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 20, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
